dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model

Class XPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.XPath

  • public class XPath
extends java.lang.Object
    This class cotains the XPath related functionality of a DCtxt object. This class is not intended to be subclassed!

    XPath queries

    This class allows to query String values accessible via XPath expressions e.g.: 
     String value = ctxt.xpath.getValue("5*3+1");
 String[] values = ctxt.xpath.getValues("//*[name(.) = 'Test']");
    Boolean values: 
     boolean value = ctxt.xpath.isTrue("count( //*[name(.) = 'Test'] ) > 1");
    List of referenced contexts: 
     DCtxt c = ctxt.xpath.get("/Single/Path");
 List<DCtxt> c = ctxt.xpath.getAll("//*[name(.) = 'Test']");
    It is also possible to navigate via an XPath expression: 
     ctxt.xpath.to("/Single/*[name(.) = 'Test' ]");

    Variables

    XPath allows to define variables. These variables can be set via: 
     ctxt.xpath.setVariable("varName", "varValue");
    From an XPath expression such a variable can be accessed via: 
     ctxt.xpath.getValue("$varName");

    Caution

    With XPath expressions it is possible to select nodes that do either not exist or which are optional and disabled. If you use such nodes in XPath expressions the XPath engine implicitly assumes values for the nodes even if the nodes do not exist, instead of resulting in an error (e.g. the expression 'NonExistingNode + 3.0' evaluates to '3.0').

    The result of evaluating XPath expressions within the DCtxt may differ from the result when using the same XPath expression within the XPath console or the template based code generator in the case when:

    • trying to access non-existing nodes within the XPath expression and
    • the option 'ExistingNodesOnly' is set to false (Opt.setExistingNodesOnly(boolean))

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    2008.a
